instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2796: What is 820-2796? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no camera.
threads.message:
hi, as the title say, theres no camera detected, i have narrowed down the problem to logicboard
my known good logicboard can detect the camera inside customer chassis.

<SIGNAL>USB_CAMERA_N</SIGNAL> and p diode mode is same at 0.411
i dont see another line for camera, is the mcp fucked?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no camera.
threads.message:
Check voltage and diode mode to ground on data lines.
Be sure the camera connector is good.

All the other USB devices are in working condition?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no camera.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_A_S3_SCL</SIGNAL> : 0.470
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_A_S3_SDA</SIGNAL> :0.479
smbus__mcp_0_data : 0.424
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_MCP_0_CLK</SIGNAL> ; 0.424
all of the voltage above is 3.3v
other function is okay.
camera connector is sure good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no camera.
threads.message:
Aaaa, you've already posted 0.411 for both lines.
If voltage is also the same, then MCP problem...
